content.body: annevk: The error messaging is fixed, but there is one new issue that'll affect this spec. I've switched Markdown's backtick-code-span syntax to being part of Bikeshed's core syntax for now (alongside the backtick-code-*blocks*, which are already core syntax), and fetch uses those backticks a good bit. (As does Infra and anyone using byte sequences using Infra syntax.) :/ Wonder if I should revert that and go back to it being gated behind the markdown shorthand flag.
content.formatted_body: annevk: The error messaging is fixed, but there is one new issue that'll affect this spec. I've switched Markdown's backtick-code-span syntax to being part of Bikeshed's core syntax for now (alongside the backtick-code-blocks, which are already core syntax), and fetch uses those backticks a good bit. (As does Infra and anyone using byte sequences using Infra syntax.) :/ Wonder if I should revert that and go back to it being gated behind the markdown shorthand flag.
